DOC.detailed_description: In 2003 , Surgeon General Richard Carmona state low health literacy `` one large contributor nation 's epidemic overweight obesity . '' This assertion support recent study find low health literacy numeracy associate poor caregiver breastfeeding knowledge , incorrect mix infant formula , difficulty understand food label portion size , high Body Mass Index ( BMI ) adults child . Of particular concern impact obesity epidemic young child . Over 26 % preschool child overweight ( BMI≥85 % ) obese ( BMI≥95 % ) ( base 2007 Health Human Services/Centers Disease Control Expert Panel definition ) . Rates obesity preschool child double past decade , high increase among low income minority child -- community affect low health literacy . To date , clinical effort prevent treat childhood obesity limit efficacy . Efforts need start early , child overweight age two five time likely become overweight adolescent , subsequently high risk obesity-related complication include early-onset Type-2 Diabetes cardiovascular disease . No published clinical study rigorously address obesity prevention prior age 2 specific low-literacy numeracy focus . Addressing caregiver health literacy early childhood innovative strategy promote healthy nutrition activity among family prevent unhealthy weight gain across child 's life , would great public health significance prevent child adult chronic illness . The propose study multi-site randomize , control trial ass efficacy low-literacy/numeracy-oriented intervention design promote healthy family lifestyles prevent early childhood obesity . The intervention deliver pediatric resident physician primary care setting under-resourced community . Four academic medical center randomize : Vanderbilt University , University Miami , University North Carolina Chapel Hill , New York University . Two center receive intervention , two center receive active control . At site , cohort 250 English- Spanish-speaking caregiver-child dyad enrol follow child 's 2 month well-child visit 24-month well-child visit . The intervention include low-literacy-oriented toolkit pediatric resident use family clear health communication training pediatric resident . At control site , pediatric resident provide `` usual care '' respect lifestyle counseling , also receive injury-prevention education program act attention control . The primary hypothesis intervention improve family dietary physical activity behavior reduce rate childhood overweight ( BMI≥85 % ) age 24 month .
